div.ab: boil the oil and wax and turpentine and wool until it lessens by a third(?), then put the oil through a clean cloth, hold the oil in an angster to thicken(?). And when you want to use the oil, drip from the oil into the wound of one who has been cut or stabbed. So will he heal, with the help of God, may he be blessed and exalted. From the name of(?) Meister Shmerel.
Another thing for wounds on the other side of the page.

Take honey and rose water, one as much as the other, and linseeds (crush it very small (fine?)), and sive and mix it through the honey and rose water so that it becomes thick as a porridge, and put it in a pot and boil it together for a little while. So will it be a salve on it that will heal ulcers, certainly.
